title: Speed up dependency checks in Beads
Allow the creation of more than one agent at a time
description: When a new agent is started this locks the UI for creating agents for other issues. This should be non-blocking, with multiple agents able to be started consecutively.

title: Automate rebasing
description:
The aim was to have "current" branches and worktrees rebased to main when a pull request is merged. Could you please review and provide an update of this functionality and whether it is in place?

Could you then provide some suggestions to improve this? I would like to have some unit tests for this functionality, with a mock GitHub service to show the automatic rebasing happening.

If the rebasing fails, there should be a visual status notification in the UI that this is the case.

title: Add agent management panel
description: Add a new AgentManagementPanel control that allows the user to control the agents associated with a certain issue or PR. This should allow the user to start and stop agents, including the ability to start agents in plan or build mode.

title: Agents page currently broken
description:
The agents page currently doesn't work, showing an issue with the real-time updates not working. This appears to be due to a link across the tailscale network.

Failed to connect to real-time updates: Name or service not known (homespun.tail0d83d3.ts.net:8080)

title: Opus 4.5 should be used as default
description: PR #34 updated the default models. Opus 4.5 should be the default model, not Opus 4 as it was released recently. This appears to be causing the agent instances to not start.

title: Fix GitHub authentication for agents
description:
Agents are currently not able to push code to GitHub as they are not authenticated. Please review this and come up with a plan such that the GITHUB_TOKEN that is passed into the Homespun application is broadly accessible to the gh CLI (which should manage authentication). This also affects the beads sync command.

Add a new beads issue for creating a new a settings page with a link to the Homespun side bar that shows the health of the current gh authentication and git credentials.
close_reason: Implemented GitHubEnvironmentService to inject GITHUB_TOKEN into agent processes. Added Settings page at /settings to show auth status.

title: Fix Beads setup for new repositories
description: When a new repository is cloned in, the  d init command seems to cause a failure on windows due to LF characters being added to the .beads/ files.

title: Start new agents with Opus by default rather than Sonnet
description: Currently when clicking on the "Start agent" button "Sonnet" is the model that is used to start. Could you please update this to be "Opus" by default, and add a drop-down to the AgentManagementPanel to allow different models to be used?

title: Set up Homespun hosting
description:
I would like to be able to host Homespun on Ubuntu virtual machines and as containers (on Azure Container Apps, for example). I will be connecting to both of these through the browser on another machine over a Tailscale private network. Could you please do the following:

Virtual machines:

In a new folder `install/vm` please add a shell script `install.sh` that creates a new systemmd service for the application. It should ensure that Kestrel binds to the Tailscale interface and set up a reverse proxy using nginx so that I can access the site without a port number. Then add a `run.sh` script that runs the systemd service and enables it at boot.

Container apps:

Please create the relevant files required to set up a Docker container for the application. It will need to have beads, git and gh CLI tools installed.

Add a docs/installation.md file with these instructions and link to it in the README.md.

title: Adjust new issue UI
description:
On mobile the UI for creating a new task renders incorrectly, showing the title then group in the top row and the type and accept button in the bottom row. It should instead show as the type and group on the top row and the title expanded to as wide as possible with the accept button on the far right. Please include an ASCII image of this in your plan so I can review it before continuing.

When the accept button is clicked the UI is locked down until the issue is created. Instead of doing this, please add the creation as a task to an asynchronous queue, and provide notifications when the issue is created or fails to be created. For the issue created notification, add an "Edit" link to the notification so the issue can be opened for editing.

title: Placeholders for past PRs
description: Past PRs don't show up at all until they pop in and move all of the current items. Please update this such that there are placeholders for 5 PRs that are the same size as the PRs will be when they are loaded. They should be replaced when the PRs are loaded.

title: Show all models available from OpenCode
description:
Currently we are just showing some Anthropic models for OpenCode rather than the full list of available models. Could you please add another "Models" tab on the left that allows the user to review the models that are available from OpenCode, add "favourite" models that show up at the top of the list when new agents are being run.

The command `opencode models --json` can be used to extract all of the model information. Use this command first to understand the schema before starting.

Before starting, please ensure that this branch and worktree is up to date with `main` and let me know if it is not. If it is not, please rebase and pull from main before starting.

title: Show agent status
description: The agent status (working or waiting) should be determined by the Agent Manager. This should be displayed both in the Agents page as well as in the timeline.

title: Link issues to PRs when the PR is created
description:
When the PRs are created (and there should be a regular polling services that catches PRs being created) the issues should be linked to them such that only one item is shown in the timeline.

The information from both the issue and the PR should be shown.

When the PR has been merged or closed the issue should also be updated.

title: Allow agents to be resumed
description:
Currrently agents can't be resumed for issues that are in progress as the following error gets shown:

Failed to transition issue hsp-1hq to InProgress: Issue is already InProgress

Please update the transition manager to allow for this to occur as this isn't really an issue.

title: Graph should be refreshed when new issues added
description: When a new issue is added (or any `beads sync` is run, for that matter) the graph view should be refreshed.

title: Ensure main is up to date when creating new branch
description: When a new branch and worktree is created from an issue, it is created from the `main` branch of the repository. In doing so, please pull the `main` branch to ensure it is up to date **before** creating the new branch off `main`.

title: Simplify new issue creation
description:
I would like to simplify the creation of new beads issues as follows:

1. Issues should be created with just an optional group, type and a required title at first. This should create the issue and allow details to be filled in later.
2. The creation of issues should be moved from a separate page at /projects/xxx/issues/create to be a box at the bottom of the main project page, similar to how new issues are created in Microsoft Todo or GitHub projects.
3. This box should float above the rest of the page. It should have be organised as three side-by-side input controls for "Group" (text box, optional) "Type" (dropdown box, optional) and "Title" (text box). These should be slimline with placeholders to show what they mean.
4. Once created, clicking on an issue should open an "Issue" panel which displays information about the issue on the right hand side of the timeline. An edit button at the top right corner of the panel should allow the various details of the issue (the items currently shown on the /projects/xxx/issues/create page) to be edited.
5. CTRL+Enter should close this edit box and update the issue.

title: Create Settings page with GitHub/git authentication health display
description:
Create a Settings page accessible from the sidebar that displays:
- GitHub CLI authentication status (from gh auth status)
- Git credential helper status
- Masked GITHUB_TOKEN display
- Configuration instructions
- Refresh/re-authenticate button

This provides visibility into authentication health for troubleshooting agent push issues.

Related to: hsp-3dc (Fix GitHub authentication for agents)

title: Update main cloud setup to Docker container on VM
Run bd sync on cloned repositories
Update new issue form
description:
The new issue form needs a UI update:

Updates:
- The Group, Type and Branch ID should be grouped together as these form the basis of the branch name. Place these in a single row when at desktop size with three columns. At mobile size they can remain stacked one above another. They should be ordered Group, Type then Branch ID.
- Remove the outline around all text boxes and dropdown box controls. Just use a thin (1px) slightly lighter outline to indicate when a text box is active.
- Add rounding to the dropdown controls.
- Add more space above the control labels.
- Add more space above the buttons at the bottom of the page.
- Make the labels smaller in size. The generated branch name should be more obvious than the label "Branch Name (Generated)".
- Change "Branch Name Preview" to just "Branch Name".
- Make the "Description" box much larger in height by default (about double the size).
- When the "Create Issue" button is clicked, the user should be sent back to the "Project" page that shows all issues and PRs for the project - currently nothing happens.

title: Fix new issue UI
description:
The new issue form UI still has some remaining issues with the UI, namely:

- The label text is still quite large. It should be roughly the same size as the details below the inputs, but bold and white.
- The label text for the Branch Name should be the same style as for the other labels.
- There is still a blue outline around the dropdown boxes, the description, the parent issue, additional labels and blocked by.
- The labels are in Title Case. They should generally be in Sentence case. This should apply across the board in this application, so please add this instruction to the AGENTS.md
